input: Of honourable reckoning are you both;
response: And pity 'tis you lived at odds so long.

input: And pity 'tis you lived at odds so long.
response: But now, my lord, what say you to my suit?

input: But now, my lord, what say you to my suit?
response: Younger than she are happy mothers made.

input: Younger than she are happy mothers made.
response: These times of woe afford no time to woo.

input: These times of woe afford no time to woo.
response: Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.

input: Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.
response: Monday, my lord,

input: Monday, my lord,
response: My lord, I would that Thursday were to-morrow.

input: My lord, I would that Thursday were to-morrow.
response: My father Capulet will have it so;

input: My father Capulet will have it so;
response: And I am nothing slow to slack his haste.

input: And I am nothing slow to slack his haste.
response: Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt's death,

input: Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt's death,
response: And therefore have I little talk'd of love;

input: And therefore have I little talk'd of love;
response: For Venus smiles not in a house of tears.

input: For Venus smiles not in a house of tears.
response: Now, sir, her father counts it dangerous

input: Now, sir, her father counts it dangerous
response: That she doth give her sorrow so much sway,

input: That she doth give her sorrow so much sway,
response: And in his wisdom hastes our marriage,

input: And in his wisdom hastes our marriage,
response: To stop the inundation of her tears;

input: To stop the inundation of her tears;
response: Which, too much minded by herself alone,

input: Which, too much minded by herself alone,
response: May be put from her by society:

input: May be put from her by society:
response: Now do you know the reason of this haste.

input: Now do you know the reason of this haste.
response: Happily met, my lady and my wife!

input: Happily met, my lady and my wife!
response: That may be must be, love, on Thursday next.

input: That may be must be, love, on Thursday next.
response: Come you to make confession to this father?

input: Come you to make confession to this father?
response: Do not deny to him that you love me.

input: Do not deny to him that you love me.
response: So will ye, I am sure, that you love me.

input: So will ye, I am sure, that you love me.
response: Poor soul, thy face is much abused with tears.

input: Poor soul, thy face is much abused with tears.
response: Thou wrong'st it, more than tears, with that report.

input: Thou wrong'st it, more than tears, with that report.
response: Thy face is mine, and thou hast slander'd it.

input: Thy face is mine, and thou hast slander'd it.
response: God shield I should disturb devotion!

input: God shield I should disturb devotion!
response: Juliet, on Thursday early will I rouse ye:

input: Juliet, on Thursday early will I rouse ye:
response: Till then, adieu; and keep this holy kiss.

input: Till then, adieu; and keep this holy kiss.
response: Exit

input: Exit
response: Have I thought long to see this morning's face,

input: Have I thought long to see this morning's face,
response: And doth it give me such a sight as this?

input: And doth it give me such a sight as this?
response: Beguiled, divorced, wronged, spited, slain!

input: Beguiled, divorced, wronged, spited, slain!
response: Most detestable death, by thee beguil'd,

input: Most detestable death, by thee beguil'd,
response: By cruel cruel thee quite overthrown!

input: By cruel cruel thee quite overthrown!
response: O love! O life! not life, but love in death!

input: O love! O life! not life, but love in death!
response: Give me thy torch, boy: hence, and stand aloof:

input: Give me thy torch, boy: hence, and stand aloof:
response: Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.

input: Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.
response: Under yond yew-trees lay thee all along,

input: Under yond yew-trees lay thee all along,
response: Holding thine ear close to the hollow ground;

input: Holding thine ear close to the hollow ground;
response: So shall no foot upon the churchyard tread,

input: So shall no foot upon the churchyard tread,
response: Being loose, unfirm, with digging up of graves,

input: Being loose, unfirm, with digging up of graves,
response: But thou shalt hear it: whistle then to me,

input: But thou shalt hear it: whistle then to me,
response: As signal that thou hear'st something approach.

input: As signal that thou hear'st something approach.
response: Give me those flowers. Do as I bid thee, go.

input: Give me those flowers. Do as I bid thee, go.
response: Sweet flower, with flowers thy bridal bed I strew,--

input: Sweet flower, with flowers thy bridal bed I strew,--
response: O woe! thy canopy is dust and stones;--

input: O woe! thy canopy is dust and stones;--
response: Which with sweet water nightly I will dew,

input: Which with sweet water nightly I will dew,
response: Or, wanting that, with tears distill'd by moans:

input: Or, wanting that, with tears distill'd by moans:
response: The obsequies that I for thee will keep

input: The obsequies that I for thee will keep
response: Nightly shall be to strew thy grave and weep.

input: Nightly shall be to strew thy grave and weep.
response: The Page whistles

input: The Page whistles
response: The boy gives warning something doth approach.

input: The boy gives warning something doth approach.
response: What cursed foot wanders this way to-night,

input: What cursed foot wanders this way to-night,
response: To cross my obsequies and true love's rite?

input: To cross my obsequies and true love's rite?
response: What with a torch! muffle me, night, awhile.

input: What with a torch! muffle me, night, awhile.
response: Retires

input: Retires
response: Enter ROMEO and BALTHASAR, with a torch, mattock, & c

input: Enter ROMEO and BALTHASAR, with a torch, mattock, & c
response: This is that banish'd haughty Montague,

input: This is that banish'd haughty Montague,
response: That murder'd my love's cousin, with which grief,

input: That murder'd my love's cousin, with which grief,
response: It is supposed, the fair creature died;

input: It is supposed, the fair creature died;
response: And here is come to do some villanous shame

input: And here is come to do some villanous shame
response: To the dead bodies: I will apprehend him.

input: To the dead bodies: I will apprehend him.
response: Comes forward

input: Comes forward
response: Stop thy unhallow'd toil, vile Montague!

input: Stop thy unhallow'd toil, vile Montague!
response: Can vengeance be pursued further than death?

input: Can vengeance be pursued further than death?
response: Condemned villain, I do apprehend thee:

input: Condemned villain, I do apprehend thee:
response: Obey, and go with me; for thou must die.

input: Obey, and go with me; for thou must die.
response: I do defy thy conjurations,

input: I do defy thy conjurations,
response: And apprehend thee for a felon here.

input: And apprehend thee for a felon here.
response: O, I am slain!

input: O, I am slain!
response: Falls

input: Falls
response: If thou be merciful,

input: If thou be merciful,
response: Open the tomb, lay me with Juliet.

response: Dies
